definition: apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc

sentences.english: Should I go up to the rooftop?
The rain drummed loudly on the metal roof.
sentences.chinese: 雨点敲击金属屋顶，发出很大的声响。

sentences.english: Interior is very attractive, living room with arched roof, leaded glass windows.
sentences.chinese: 内部非常诱人，客厅有拱形屋顶，铅玻璃窗户。

sentences.english: The rain percolated through the roof.
Bell sitting on his roof, sings delightedly.
sentences.chinese: 贝尔坐在自家屋顶上乐滋滋地唱歌。

sentences.english: The roof was supported by a comparatively traditional post-and-beam system.
sentences.chinese: 建筑屋顶由相对传统的后梁系统支撑。

sentences.english: She also practices boxing, planting vegetables on her roof garden, and cooks all by herself.
sentences.chinese: 她还练习拳击，在屋顶花园种蔬菜，自己做饭。

sentences.english: They used pitch to cover roofs.
After we’d finished working, we climbed down and picked up our tools.
sentences.chinese: 干完活后，我们收拾好工具爬下屋顶。

sentences.english: The house in which I lived last year has been unroofed now.
sentences.chinese: 我去年居住的那所房子的屋顶现已拆掉。

sentences.english: The roof is slate to match the surrounding buildings.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶用石板瓦盖以适应周围的建筑。

sentences.english: The hammer and sickle was flying over the roof.
sentences.chinese: 镰刀斧头旗在屋顶上下空飘扬。

sentences.english: Be careful, the roof might cave in and we'll fall through!
sentences.chinese: 小心点，屋顶可能要塌，我们会掉下去的。

sentences.english: Flying to the roof on a broom.
The swimming pool will be roofed over in October this year.
sentences.chinese: 游泳池将于今年十月加盖屋顶。

sentences.english: Along the roof line there are 10 pointed cupolas.
sentences.chinese: 沿着屋顶线条有10处突出的炮塔。

definition: balcony/patio/flat roof/terrace/deck (unroofed platform)/outdoor stage/ancient imperial celestial observation terrace
